## 2 Changing Gait Speed {#form-changing-gait-speed}

Instructions: Begin walking at your normal pace (for 1.5 m [5 ft]). When
I tell you “go,” walk as fast as you can (for 1.5 m [5 ft]). When I tell you
“slow,” walk as slowly as you can (for 1.5 m [5 ft]).

<table class="basic-table">
    <thead>

            <th>Level</th>
            <th>Criteria</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr onclick="setScore(3, this, 'score2')" data-score-group="score2" style="cursor: pointer;">
            <td>3</td>
            <td>Normal</td>
            <td>Able to smoothly change walking speed without loss of balance or gait deviation. Shows a significant difference in walking speeds between normal, fast, and slow speeds. Deviates no more than 15.24 cm (6 in) outside of the 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width.</td>
        </tr>
        <tr onclick="setScore(2, this, 'score2')" data-score-group="score2" style="cursor: pointer;">
            <td>2</td>
            <td>Mild</td>
            <td>Is able to change speed but demonstrates mild gait deviations, deviates 15.24 – 25.4 cm (6 – 10 in) outside of the 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width, or no gait deviations but unable to achieve a significant change in velocity, or uses an assistive device.</td>
        </tr>

            <td>1</td>

## 3 Gait with Horizontal Head Turns {#form-horizontal-head-turn}

Instructions: Walk from here to the next mark 6 m (20 ft) away. Begin
walking at your normal pace. Keep walking straight; after 3 steps, turn
your head to the right and keep walking straight while looking to the
right. After 3 more steps, turn your head to the left and keep walking
straight while looking left. Continue alternating looking right and left
every 3 steps until you have completed 2 repetitions in each direction.


<table class="basic-table">
    <thead>
        <tr>
            <th>Score</th>
            <th>Level</th>
            <th>Criteria</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>

            <td>3</td>
            <td>Normal</td>
            <td>Performs head turns smoothly with no change in gait. Deviates no more than 15.24 cm (6 in) outside 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width.</td>
        </tr>
        <tr onclick="setScore(2, this, 'score3')" data-score-group="score3" style="cursor: pointer;">
            <td>2</td>
            <td>Mild impairment</td>
            <td>Performs head turns smoothly with slight change in gait velocity (eg, minor disruption to smooth gait path), deviates 15.24 – 25.4 cm (6 – 10 in) outside 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width, or uses an assistive device.</td>
        </tr>
        <tr onclick="setScore(1, this, 'score3')" data-score-group="score3" style="cursor: pointer;">
            <td>1</td>
            <td>Moderate impairment</td>
            <td>Performs head turns with moderate change in gait velocity, slows down, deviates 25.4 – 38.1 cm (10 – 15 in) outside 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width but recovers, can continue to walk.</td>
        </tr>
        <tr onclick="setScore(0, this, 'score3')" data-score-group="score3" style="cursor: pointer;">

            <td>Performs task with severe disruption of gait (eg, staggers 38.1 cm [15 in] outside 30.48-cm (12-in) walkway width, loses balance, stops, or reaches for wall).</td>

<script>
    function setScore(value, element, scoreId) {
        // Update the displayed score in all elements with the scoreId class
        const scoreElements = document.querySelectorAll(`.${scoreId}`);
        scoreElements.forEach(el => el.innerText = value); // Update all instances

        // Reset background color for all elements in the same group
        const elements = document.querySelectorAll(`[data-score-group="${scoreId}"]`);
        elements.forEach(el => el.style.backgroundColor = ''); // Reset all elements

        // Highlight the clicked element with a color based on the score value
        let color;
        switch (value) {
            case 3:
                color = '#aae8a9'; // Color for Normal
                break;
            case 2:
                color = '#f2e9ae'; // Color for Mild
                break;
            case 1:
                color = '#f7b18b'; // Color for Moderate
                break;
            case 0:
                color = '#fa8484'; // Color for Severe
                break;
            default:
                color = ''; // Default (no highlight)
        }
        element.style.backgroundColor = color; // Set the background color

        // Recalculate the totals
        calculateTotal();
    }


    function calculateTotal() {
        // Get the current scores from the spans
        const score1 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score1").innerText) || 0;
        const score2 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score2").innerText) || 0;
        const score3 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score3").innerText) || 0;
        const score4 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score4").innerText) || 0;
        const score5 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score5").innerText) || 0;
        const score6 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score6").innerText) || 0;
        const score7 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score7").innerText) || 0;
        const score8 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score8").innerText) || 0;
        const score9 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score9").innerText) || 0;
        const score10 = parseInt(document.querySelector(".score10").innerText) || 0;

        // Calculate the total score
        const total = score1 + score2 + score3 + score4 + score5 + score6 + score7 + score8 + score9 + score10;

        // Update the total score display
        document.querySelectorAll(".totalScore").forEach(el => {
            el.innerText = total; // Update each totalScore element
        });
    }

</script>



<!-- Copy button for copying the final results to clipboard -->
<button id="copyButton">Copy Scores</button>

<script>
    document.getElementById('copyButton').addEventListener('click', function() {
        // Get today's date in "Mon DD, YYYY" format
        let today = new Date();
        let formattedDate = today.toLocaleDateString('en-US', { month: 'short', day: 'numeric', year: 'numeric' });

        // Initialize an array to hold the score texts
        let scoresToCopy = [`Yomokerst - Functional Gait Assessment (${formattedDate})`];

        // Get the text content of each score class and add it to the array
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 1 Level Gait: ${document.querySelector('.score1').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 2 Changing speed: ${document.querySelector('.score2').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 3 Horizontal Head turns: ${document.querySelector('.score3').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 4 Vertical Head turns: ${document.querySelector('.score4').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 5 Pivot turn: ${document.querySelector('.score5').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 6 Step over obstacle: ${document.querySelector('.score6').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 7 Narrow base: ${document.querySelector('.score7').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 8 Eyes closed: ${document.querySelector('.score8').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 9 Backwards: ${document.querySelector('.score9').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Item 10 Stairs: ${document.querySelector('.score10').innerText}`);
        scoresToCopy.push(`Total: ${document.querySelector('.totalScore').innerText}`);

        // Join the scores with a new line character
        let textToCopy = scoresToCopy.join('\n');

        // Create a temporary textarea element to hold the text
        let tempTextArea = document.createElement('textarea');
        tempTextArea.value = textToCopy;

        // Append the textarea to the body (required for the copy command)
        document.body.appendChild(tempTextArea);

        // Select the text in the textarea
        tempTextArea.select();

        // Copy the text to the clipboard
        document.execCommand('copy');

        // Remove the temporary textarea
        document.body.removeChild(tempTextArea);

        // Optional: Alert the user that the text has been copied
        alert('Scores copied to clipboard!');
    });
</script>
